game.engine.d2.object.sprite

Class SpriteSceneObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.engine.d2.object.SceneObject
      • game.engine.d2.object.sprite.SpriteSceneObject
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Sprite2DSceneObject

    public class SpriteSceneObject
extends SceneObject
    Animates a sprite. Every row is treated as a single animation and can be switched.
    Author:
    Marvin Bruns

    • Constructor Detail

      • SpriteSceneObject

        public SpriteSceneObject(Sprite sprite,
                         long defaultTime,
                         long[][] time,
                         int[] frames)
        Create an SpriteSceneObject from a sprite. Only one row will be used for animation. The row used for this animation can be changed.
        Parameters:
        sprite - The animated sprite
        defaultTime - Nanosecond for animation used if no individual time is provided
        time - Time for every frame. Long[row][frame]. Zero means stable image, it won't be animated.
        frames - An array containing the number of frames used for every row. If negative or too high the sprite's maximum frame number is used.

      • SpriteSceneObject

        public SpriteSceneObject(Sprite sprite,
                         long defaultTime,
                         long[][] time)
        Create an SpriteSceneObject from a sprite with full frames per row.
        Parameters:
        sprite - The animated sprite
        defaultTime - Time for each frame where not specified
        time - individual time for every frame
        See Also:
        SpriteSceneObject(Sprite, long, long[][], int[])

      • SpriteSceneObject

        public SpriteSceneObject(Sprite sprite,
                         long defaultTime)
        Create an SpriteSceneObject from a sprite with equal time for every frame.
        Parameters:
        sprite - The animated sprite
        defaultTime - Time for each frame
        See Also:
        SpriteSceneObject(Sprite, long, long[][])

      • getAnimationFrame

        public int getAnimationFrame()
        Get the frame of the current row in animation
        Returns:
        Current animated frame in row

      • setAnimationFrame

        public void setAnimationFrame(int frame)
        Set the frame of the current row in animation. If it is greater than the available frames the next frame in animation is chosen. Remember, that this will it will take affect when the animation is painted the next time. So if the next frame is this which should be painted you might set to the frame before.
        Parameters:
        frame - The current animated frame in row

      • resetAnimation

        public void resetAnimation()
        Resets actual animation. The first frame in actual row will be painted next time.

      • getTileHeight

        public int getTileHeight()
        Get the height of one frame of the underlying sprite.
        Returns:
        Height of one original frame

      • paint

        protected void paint(Graphics2D g,
                     long elapsedTime)
        Description copied from class: SceneObject
        Paint this SceneObject. This method maybe called for collision testing with an elapsed time of zero. For correct collision the SceneObject it is important, that the object is drawn in it's actual state.
        Specified by:
        paint in class SceneObject
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics Object for painting
        elapsedTime - Elapsed time since the last call to this method

      • recalculateFrame

        protected void recalculateFrame(long elapsedTime)
        Recalculates the current visible frame depending on the elapsed time. Row restarts if it reaches end an the last frame has a time > 0.

        public Point getOrigin()
        Description copied from class: SceneObject
        The origin of this SceneObject. This object's position will be translated to it's origin. The default implementation returns SceneObject.ORIGIN_TOP_LEFT
